result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:07 PM Defendant Gerald Benjamin Diamond appeared by video, in custody from Dodge Correctional.  Attorney John A Birdsall appeared by video for Gerald Benjamin Diamond. State makes argument on motion for dismissal.  Attny Birdsall continues argument.  Court denies motion to dismiss.    Through Attorney Birdsall DEF waives time limits for preliminary hearing, DEF agrees.   Court sets preliminary hearing.   Attny Birdsall to make arrangements with Dodge for DEF to appear.

records.addlTxt:
COMBINED BOND  20CF243 and 22CF40

NO CONTACT with Billie D. John, Sabrina Kagigebi and Juan Jimenez

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-338-3976 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.
SERVED:  02/15/2022  T. Engel #398  5:00 pm

11:16AM Defendant Gerald Benjamin Diamond in court, appearing by video from in custody in Sawyer County Jail, with Atty Gabriel Pollak (special appearance), appearing by video.  Jennifer Gross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court calls case (20CF243, 22CF40) and recites appearances.  Court reviews case.  Court quashes warrant.  Atty Pollak makes statement, indicates DEF has not applied for PD appointment in new case (22CF40), Atty Mulligan is atty of record in old case (20CF243).  DEF makes statement on missed appearance and contact with Atty Mulligan.  Court has discussion with DEF.   Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint. DEF updates address, verifies DOB.  State makes bond recommendation, asking to amend bond in 20CF243 to include 22CF40. DEF makes statement.  Atty Pollak argues bond.  Court addresses DEF, indicates bond will not be forfeited in 20CF243, amends bond in 20CF243.  Court explains options to DEF on prelim and waiver of time limits.  DEF waives time limits for prelim.  Court sets Prelim for 3/1/22 at 1:30pm.  DEF asks for clarification, Court responds.

COURT:  Amended CBS $100,000  -- COMBINED BOND  20CF243 and 22CF40

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision.
